page.title: 13E.Malling Research Station
page.content: E.M.R.S is funded by the Agricultural and Food Research Council and is the main fruit research station in the UK. Woody plants studied are apple, pear, cherry and plum. Soft fruits studied are strawberry, raspberry, gooseberry, loganberry, red and black currant. Investigations into hop diseases and pests are carried out and some work is done on ornamental shrubs. Better fruit storage methods are developed. The main aim is to help growers to produce top quality fruit. 135 scientists and 185 other workers are employed. The station has about 580 acres of land, most of which is used for experimental orchards, nurseries and glasshouses. E.M.R.S is known world-wide and overseas officials, growers and students are frequent visitors.
